fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA doesn't support  preflighted requests for CORS. There are a couple of problems:
* It doesn't respect content of {{Access-Control-Request-Method}} header
* It doesn't reply with {{Access-Control-Allow...}} headers

h2. Problem1
h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure CORS at JIRA for domain 'http://mysite.com'
# Fire the OPTIONS REST call with {{Origin}} and {{Access-Control-Request-...}} headers. 
{code}
curl -v -uadmin:admin -X OPTIONS -H 'Access-Control-Request-Method: GET' -H 'Access-Control-Request-Headers: authorization' -H 'Origin: http://mysite.com'  http://127.0.0.1:8081/rest/api/latest/issue/PRG-4 -o /dev/null

> OPTIONS /rest/api/latest/issue/PRG-4 HTTP/1.1
> Access-Control-Request-Method: GET
> Access-Control-Request-Headers: authorization
> Origin: http://mysite.com
{code}
Please note that performing certain types of cross-domain AJAX requests, modern browsers that support CORS will insert an extra "preflight" request to determine whether they have permission to perform the action. Eg. Firefox uses "preflight" request for methods other than GET, HEAD or POST. 

h4. Expected Results
Response has header with following content:
{code}
Access-Control-Allow-Origin: http://mysite.com
Access-Control-Allow-Methods: OPTIONS, GET, PUT, DELETE
Access-Control-Allow-Credentials: true
Access-Control-Expose-Headers: Origin, Authorization, Content-Type
{code}

h4. Actual Results
Response has header with following content:
{code}
< HTTP/1.1 200 OK
{code}
No {{Access-Control-Allow...}} headers

h2. Problem2
h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure CORS at JIRA for domain 'http://mysite.com'
# Fire the OPTIONS REST call with {{Origin}} and {{Access-Control-Request-Method}} headers. 
{code}
curl -v -X OPTIONS -u admin:1 -H 'Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8' -H 'Origin: http://mysite.com' -H 'Access-Control-Request-Method: PUT' http://127.0.0.1:8080/rest/api/2/issue/DRA-2/properties/10000 -o /dev/nul

> Origin: http://mysite.com
> Access-Control-Request-Method: PUT
{code}
Please note that performing certain types of cross-domain AJAX requests, modern browsers that support CORS will insert an extra "preflight" request to determine whether they have permission to perform the action. Eg. Firefox uses "preflight" request for methods other than GET, HEAD or POST. 

h4. Expected Results
Response has header with following content:
{code}
Access-Control-Allow-Methods: OPTIONS, GET, PUT, DELETE
Access-Control-Allow-Headers: Authorization, Content-Type
{code}

h4. Actual Results
Response has header with following content:
{code}
< HTTP/1.1 200 OK
< Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1
....
< X-ASESSIONID: qszqfh
< X-AUSERNAME: admin
< Access-Control-Allow-Origin: http://mysite.com
< Access-Control-Allow-Credentials: true
< Access-Control-Allow-Headers: Content-Type
< Access-Control-Allow-Methods: OPTIONS
{code}
And the leads to error message in browser: 
- _Method PUT is not allowed by Access-Control-Allow-Methods in preflight response._
-- OR
- _Request header field Authorization is not allowed by Access-Control-Allow-Headers in preflight response_

h3. Notes
Please see specification for details: 
* https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Access_control_CORS
* http://www.w3.org/TR/access-control/#preflight-request

h3.Workaround
Setup a proxy and rewrite  {{Access-Control-Request-Method}} header. See for example: [Apache, as a proxy|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Answers-Developer-Questions/Cross-Origin-Resource-Sharing-with-JIRA-REST-API-and-Javascript/qaq-p/484801]
fields.summary: Jira doesn't support  preflighted requests for CORS

fields.description:
If you create a pie chart from saved filter it shows "Total Issues" link which links to the Issue Navigator. But the link show only JQL query and its results not the saved filter. It means that your filter settings from the saved filter are not respected - for example columns settings.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
#     Create a saved filter and chose your columns to show in result set
#     Create a pie chart on the dashboard from the filter
#     Click the link "Total Issues"

h3. Expected Results
The link should links the saved filter. Probably by its ID as it does Issue Navigator  for example: "/jira/issues/?filter=12651"




h3. Actual Results
Link links JQL query only. For example: "/jira/issues/?jql=issuetype %3D Bug"
fields.summary: Pie charts - "Total Issues" link do not link the saved filter

  {panel}

h3. Summary:
If we click the "Download" button, rather than being redirected to our website download page, it will be better if it just download it from JIRA UI.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Login as admin
# Navigate to _JIRA Administration Page > Applications > Versions & Licenses_
# On JIRA Core section, click the "Download" button.
(i) button will be only available if there is newer release for JIRA Core
# There will be a pop-up with list of the installer that the user get.
# Click "Get Installer"

h3. Current Result:
# The user will be redirected to Atlassian Website JIRA Core download page.

h3. Desired Result:
# Like any other Applications, it will automatically download the installer from the UI, even though it is not possible to update automatically like other application.
# A pop-up after downloading the installer will be great. The pop-up will include information about how to upgrade JIRA.

h3. Important Notes:
# This particular page is also confusing the User.
 !Download Page.png|thumbnail! 
# They will thought that to upgrade JIRA Core( or JIRA platform) a license is needed.
# Even though, *clicking Download will download the installer without the need of a license*
fields.summary: Automatically Download JIRA Core installer from the Versions & Licenses page

fields.description:
*Decreased to Minor because the problem is only occuring in Oracle XE running in Windows.*

 

Spinning up a fresh JIRA instalation against a clean Oracle database fails when creating admin account on the initial setup.

"Set up administrator account"
 "Cannot add user, all the user directories are read-only."

The error does not happen with 7.0.5 with Postgres.
 The error does not happen with 6.4.8 with Oracle.

Affects 7.0.5

Database Version: Oracle - Oracle Database 11g Express Edition Release 11.2.0.2.0 - Production
 Database Driver: Oracle JDBC driver - 11.2.0.2.0

 

Step to reproduce:
 * Download JIRA 7.0.5 from WAC [https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/post-download?file=https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/downloads/binary/atlassian-jira-software-7.0.5-jira-7.0.5.tar.gz|https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/post-download?file=https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/downloads/binary/atlassian-jira-software-7.0.5-jira-7.0.5.tar.gz]
 * Clean oracle database
 * Create a jira-home directore with this dbconfig.xml;
 * bin/start-jira.sh
 * Follow the initial setup process
 * You will get the error of directory read only when setting up admin account;

 
{code:java}<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<jira-database-config>
  <name>defaultDS</name>
  <delegator-name>default</delegator-name>
  <database-type>oracle10g</database-type>
  <jdbc-datasource>
    <url>jdbc:oracle:thin:@jiratestxp:1521</url>
    <driver-class>oracle.jdbc.OracleDriver</driver-class>
    <username>jirauser</username>
    <password>jirauser</password>
    <pool-min-size>20</pool-min-size>
    <pool-max-size>20</pool-max-size>
    <pool-max-wait>30000</pool-max-wait>
    <min-evictable-idle-time-millis>4000</min-evictable-idle-time-millis>
    <time-between-eviction-runs-millis>5000</time-between-eviction-runs-millis>
    <pool-max-idle>20</pool-max-idle>
    <pool-remove-abandoned>true</pool-remove-abandoned>
    <pool-remove-abandoned-timeout>300</pool-remove-abandoned-timeout>
  </jdbc-datasource>
</jira-database-config>
{code}
fields.summary: Setup administrator account fails in JIRA with Oracle

fields.description:
When viewing issues in the List View mode and the Filters pane/left column is set to hide and display when mouse over, there are certain cases which causes the display error as shown in the attached document.

The following conditions are neccessary to replicate the issue:
* IE11 (it is not reproducible in Firefox)
* The filter list must be set to hide, and show only on mouse over
* You must have enough favorite filters to fill the column
* The selected filter/issues you look at must be few (2 is few issues. 12 is not)
fields.summary: Favorite Filters display bug on List View

fields.description:
We have different user-roles. We add a comment. We mention somebody from user-role = 1 in this comment. After this we restrict this comment to user-role = 2 and save it.

The user which we have mentioned (user-role = 1) gets an email with the text we have added in the comment. So in the mail he can see the text!
If he opens the issue he cannot see the comment because it is only viewable for 
user-role = 2.

In our suggestion the user should not see the content of this comment in the mail JIRA sends to him. Because the comment was restricted to an user group where this user does not belong to.
fields.summary: Add a comment - mention somebody and restrict to....

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59079].
  {panel}

If the same custom field name is used in several projects for a custom field and custom fields are distinct (e.g. projects do not share fields configuration), issue search produces incorrect results for the following request:

"custom field" is EMPTY

Namely, issues with non-empty values for "custom field" are returned as well.

The following requests

cf[10201] is EMPTY
-or-
"custom field" is EMPTY AND Project="prj"

does not work as well (include issues with non-empty custom field values).

The only way to workaround is to use the following jql:

cf[10201] is EMPTY AND Project="prj"

This is definitely a bug and should be fixed.
fields.summary: "custom field" is EMPTY does not work if "custom field" is used in several projects

fields.description:
{panel:title=Cloned from JSD-2419|bgColor=#f5f5f5}
This was cloned from JSD issue, as during our investigations we found the following:

* JIRA Issue View honours the Inline Edit Setting as expected
* JIRA Issue Navigator and JIRA Software boards (as well as JIRA Service Desk queues) do not honour this setting.
* It appears as though an underlying fix to the Issue Navigator is required that should filter through to JIRA Software and JIRA Service Desk
{panel}

h5. Scenario
1. Disable inline editing in JIRA's System Settings.
 !system_settings.png|thumbnail! 
2. In the Service Desk menu, click on a service desk, so you get to see the Queues screen.
3. Click on an issue.

h5. Expected behaviour
The issue should not be editable inline because this is disabled in JIRA's system settings.

h5. Actual behaviour
The fields of the issue are editable inline.
E.g. the description field:
 !Inline edit 1.png|thumbnail!

E.g. the priority field: 
 !Inline edit 2.png|thumbnail! 

There are several reasons why we want to disable inline editing:
- We want to limit the number of notifications customers receive. In an edit dialog, users are more likely to update all fields at once.
- Some plugins can add custom fields that depend on each other (E.g. Kepler Database Custom Field supports child fields). These work well in an edit dialog, but not so well when editable inline.
fields.summary: Issue Navigator screen does not respect JIRA's "Inline Edit" System setting

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Latin1_General_CI_AI shown as unsupported database in JIRA's Health Check. According to KB [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Health+Check%3A+Database+Collation] it is shown as supported. 

h3. Environment
7.0.0, 7.0.2, 7.0.4

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create *Latin1_General_CI_AI* database in Microsoft SQL Database. 
# Connect JIRA to the database.
# In JIRA, health checker will show error saying *The database collation 'Latin1_General_CI_AI' is not supported by JIRA.*

h3. Expected Results

Health checker should display *Latin1_General_CI_AI* as supported database*

h3. Actual Results

Health checker display *The database collation 'Latin1_General_CI_AI' is not supported by JIRA.*

h3.Workaround
Currently there is no workaround for this issue.
fields.summary: Latin1_General_CI_AI shown as unsupported database in JIRA's Health Check

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h4.Steps to reproduce
# Modify field configuration and make Affects Version a required field
# Create new Scrum Sample board 
# Click on + to create a new epic

h4.Excepted Result
Required fields show up
h4.Actual Result
Affects Version is missing

(!) This does not only apply to the Affects Version field, but any required field.

h4. Workaround
- Add field to appropriate screen (See [Defining a Screen|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Defining+a+Screen])
- Create Epic by clicking on *Create* button on top bar.
fields.summary: Required fields does not show up when creating a new epic from plan view

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59073].
  {panel}

I tried to make a request to the following rest resource:

 !Screen Shot 2015-12-21 at 8.07.38 am.png|thumbnail! 

And got a 404. When I looked through the JIRA source code I could not even see that resource implemented in com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.admin.WorkflowsResource

However, it is documented in the pubilic JIRA documentation as though it exists: https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#api/2/workflow-getProperties

What is wrong? The documentation or the source code. I'm writing the documenation around entity properties for Atlassian Connect right now so this will affect those docs.

Note: I am developing with AMPS and my JIRA version is v7.1.0-OD-02-025#71001-sha1:64a64e8. I have also tried browsing with the Rest API Browser and don't see the documented rest resources from there either. Cheers.
fields.summary: Missing documented workflow properties rest api.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When attempting to paste a screenshot into Firefox, using CMD+V it does not automatically bring up the attach screenshot modal / popup. It works as expected with Chrome.

h3. Environment

* OS X 10.10.5
* Firefox 43.0.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Copy screenshot from Finder.
# Paste into issue in Firefox.

h3. Expected Results

The attach screenshot modal / popup appears.

h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens.

h3. Workaround

Tested and works using Chrome. Alternatively using *Attach screenshot* and then pasting in Firefox will work.
fields.summary: Unable to attach screenshot using paste in Firefox

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59067].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if you want to set assignee or reporter for an issue, the autocomplete suggestions only show users which start with the letter typed and not if the letter is contained in the username. 
Eg: 
Username: vm-john
where the user would like to type *john* in either the assignee or reporter field and get *vm-john* as a recommendation. However, currently only usernames that begin with *john* are included. 

h4. Notes
* This feature is not found for the assignee and reporter field
* This is found in the user management page when searching for a user.

h3. Suggested Solution
Give the ability to search within and not only from the starting of a username, possible by having the wildcard both at the start and the end of the username.
fields.summary: As a User, I want user search to be more flexible

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you access from a filter,  a sub-task and then access the parent task. Then clicking the browsers return button will only move change the URL back, however, the issue will remain to be the parent issue.

h3. Environment
Chrome: 47.0.2526.106 (64-bit)
Firefox: 43.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open any filter in the issue navigator
# Change the list view
# Click on a sub-task to open it in the same window
# Then open the parent task as follows:
!parent.png|thumbnail!
# Then click on your browsers back button to go back to the sub-task

h3. Expected Results
It should go back to the sub-task

h3. Actual Results
Only the URL changes back to the sub-task, however, the issue itself will still be the parent task.
!issue.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)
fields.summary: Returning from a parent Issue back to a sub-task will not load sub-task in particular circumstances
Allow screens to be restricted by a user group

h3. Summary
Date and time custom field can be displayed in an JIRA Issue. The time will be displayed based on the Timezone of the user viewing the issue. This works fine but maybe for instance the user travels a lot and will constantly have to update timezone. Sometimes this can be forgotten

h3. Suggestion
Add the timezone beside the date and time custom fields (in both viewing it or when editing the value as well)
fields.summary: Add Timezone beside date/time picker

Most email clients don't send the NUL character as they have no way for users to input this character in. This problem was found to happen when receiving Email Campaigns that are sent using scripts or programs.

h3. Environment:
JIRA
Postgres DB

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a JIRA mail handler
# Send an email with the character {{NUL}} (0x00) as part of the Description
*Expected Result:* JIRA corrects the {{NUL}} character unsupported by postgres and creates the issue normally
*Actual Result:* JIRA fails to create the issue and keeps attempting to create it every 1 minute.

This bug also causes: [JRA-38024|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-38024] - JIRA increments pcounter when UTF encoding errors occurs


h3. Note on fix
We introduced the filter to sanitize the message body during email processing by Jira Mail handler ({{com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.handlers.CreateOrCommentHandler}}): 
{code:Java|borderStyle=solid}
    public static String sanitizeText(@Nullable String text) {
        if (text == null) {
            return null;
        }
        return text.replace("\0", "");
    }
{code}

Generally speaking, the error/exception comes _OfBiz_ code when it's not being able to handle the malformed data (see JRASERVER-72673). We expect the code creating/adding issues will sanitize the data and call _OfBiz_ with valid parameters. 

(!) That being said, they could be other problems with the same symptom caused by 3rd party Apps.
fields.summary: Jira Mail Handler error "invalid byte sequence for encoding "UTF8": 0x00" prevents creation of issues by email

h3. Problem Definition

Searching for a value in fields with multiple values behaves in a way consistent with formal logic, but confusing for users relying on common sense.

h3. Suggest Solution

We introduce a new _contains_ operator for list/multi-valued types along with the existing _=_ ,_is_ and _in_ operators. The _contains_ operator has the same semantics as the _in_ or _=_ operator except when negated.

h3. Workaround

There is no current workaround.

h3. Summary
After configuring the default configuration scheme for a Custom Field with context defined for all issue types and all projects, if performing a search filtering for that Custom Field using Basic Search, the following message is returned: "Field is not applicable for the current project and/or issue type"

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Administration > Issues > Custom Fields
# Add a Custom Field named "Test"
# Navigate to that Custom Field, then go to Cog Icon > Configure
# Edit the Applicable contexts for scheme with the following:
Issue Types: Any issue type
Check "Apply to issues under selected projects" then select all projects.
# Try searching for issues using that Custom Field on Basic Search

h3. Expected Results
No warnings about the context of that Custom Field

h3. Actual Results
A warning is shown on the UI: "Field is not applicable for the current project and/or issue type".

h3.Workaround
Using Global context on the Custom Field configuration makes the behaviour not reproducible anymore.
fields.summary: Custom Field context not behaving correctly.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Modal loads slowly when creating a project and returns an error message as seen below
!timeout.png|thumbnail!

h3. Environment
* JIRA configured with multiple LDAP connectors and/or high amount of users in application

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Connect JIRA to one or more LDAP directories which syncs a large amount of users

h3. Expected Results
- Faster load on create project modal

h3. Actual Results
A large amount of time is spent fetching users. This can be seen from profiling application here:
!getProjectTemplates.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
- There is a 5 second timeout on the create project dialog in JIRA 7.0.0, 7.0.1 and 7.02 which exasperates this problem. In JIRA 7.0.4 the timeout has been increased to 60 seconds. Upgrading to a JIRA version later than 7.0.3 should help.

Original Description:
{quote}
In certain situations (a lot of external user directories) create project dialog can timeout due to slow backend processing. 
In my case client had like 17 AD configured and during the create project dialog there is some code executed:
com.atlassian.jira.projecttemplates.rest.ProjectTemplatesResource#getProjectTemplates
{code}
...
                .shouldShowProjectLead(userManager.getTotalUserCount() > 1 || !authContext.isLoggedInUser())
...
{code}
the offending line is:
{code}
userManager.getTotalUserCount() > 1
{code}
which basically means that we want to display project lead picker (user picker).
The current implementation iterates over all directories and handles shadow users and it's slow. but in this case we need only information if there are multiple users in the system (more than 1).
maybe instead of {code}userManager.getTotalUserCount(){code} we could use something like 
{code}
com.atlassian.jira.bc.user.search.DefaultUserPickerSearchService#findUsers(com.atlassian.jira.bc.JiraServiceContext, java.lang.String, com.atlassian.jira.bc.user.search.UserSearchParams)
{code}
and pass parameter that limits output to 2 users (or any other way of doing some fast query with user limit)
{quote}
fields.summary: slow execution of create project dialog
How to use System JRE Documentation Outdated

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The JIRA H2 Database does not contain constraints on field length that match the typical External database schemas. 

This allows large fields to be recorded in the embedded database that subsequently cause an import to fail, for example: {{value too long for type character varying(255)}}


h3. Environment
JIRA 7, originally hosted on an embedded database, then transported over to


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up a JIRA environment to use an embedded database. 
# Configure the JIRA instance to use an Active directory that contains long descritions for groups 
# Export the Instance as an XML Backup. 
# Switch the database, and try to import the XML backup again. The Import will fail due to content being larger than the fields in the schema definition. 


h3. Expected Results
The Constraint on fields should be applied evenly across all databases. 


h3. Actual Results
You can use long strings for content (Group descriptions, for example) in an embedded database, but not others. 


h3. Workaround
If you do happen to experience this issue, remove the offending content from your embedded database, before creating a new export.
fields.summary: H2 Embedded Database Does not constrain column length

{noformat}
Caused by: java.awt.image.RasterFormatException: negative or zero height
{noformat}

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When right clicking {{Create sub-task}} and clicking {{open in new tab}} causes an extra text field with the {{issue type ID}} to show up

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
Cloud / Server

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Open new ticket
# Click {{More}} button
# Right click {{Create sub-task}}
# Click "open in new tab"

h3. Expected Results

New tab should open and ask for details of new ticket

h3. Actual Results

New tab opens but instead requests an {{issue type ID}}
 
h3. Notes

Once you click {{Next}} you are presented with the normal screen and you are able to proceed with creating your sub-task. The task is created and associates correctly.

h3.Workaround

Rather than right clicking and opening in new tab, users should simply click {{create sub-task}}. Alternatively, if a user creates a sub-task in a new tab, he/she can simply click next, leaving the {{issue type ID}} unchanged.

If there is more than one sub-task issue type available, go to JIRA Administration > {{Issues}} > {{Sub-task}} > hover mouse to the {{Edit}} operation of the particular sub-task to see the issue type ID at the bottom left of your browser (e.g: <yourdomain>/secure/admin/subtasks/EditSubTaskIssueTypes!default.jspa?id=10005); the issue type ID is 10005
fields.summary: Opening 'Create Sub-task' in new tab does not work correctly

h3. Summary
The default filters on the top of Statistic View of JIRA Software projects points to empty results.
!Screenshot 1.png|thumbnail! !Screenshot 2.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce

  {panel}

*Problem Definition*
JIRA do not support searching words in Issue using partial word search.

This especially affect language such as German. For example:

If a Issue created created in JIRA where the default language is German:

Summary -> "Mehrmandantenfähigkeit für Clients und Reports"
Description -> "Man muss Clients und Reports pro Veranstaltung anlegen/verwalten können, da momentan noch nicht Mehrmandantenfähig."

Searching using partial word such as "Mehr" or "mehr" will not show the previous issue in the issue navigator.

*Suggested Solution*
Add partial foreign word search in JIRA. 

*Workaround*
Currently there are no workaround for this.
fields.summary: Search Issue using partial words

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-57208].
  {panel}

*Problem Definition*
Allow JIRA Admin to schedule Mail Handler. 

Currently in JIRA if users use more than 1 Mail Handler, all off it works at same time which could cause some congestion. Users would like option to schedule the Mail Handler so each of them get active at specific time.

For example lets say there are 3 Mail Handler:

Mail Handler 1 get active and deactivated after 1 minutes.
Mail Handler 2 get active after Mail Handler 1 is deactivated.
Mail Handler 3 get active after Mail Handler 2 is deactivated.
Mail Handler 1 get active after Mail Handler 3 is deactivated.
The cycles continues while JIRA is running.

In a way, each Mail Handler works periodically for 1 minutes while having specific time delay.

Also user would like option to set maximum number of IMAP connections in Mail Handler.

*Suggested Solution*
Currently in JIRA setting specific time delay still makes all the Mail Handler to be activated all the time. User would like option in Mail Handler to schedule how long each Mail Handler is active 

*Workaround*
Currently there are no workaround for this.
fields.summary: Schedule Mail Handler

h3. Summary

Importing from JIRA cloud to JIRA server 7.0.4 fails with error 'jira software is currently unavailable. This might be because an upgrade task has failed to run or has not yet completed'. Reinstalling JIRA software does not fix the issue.
h3. Environment

JIRA server 7.0.4
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Get backup of cloud instance
2. Install latest version of jira 7.0.4
3. Run XML import which completes without error.
4. On first run of jira you receive the message jira software is currently unavailable. This might be because an upgrade task has failed to run or has not yet completed.
h3. Expected Results

JIRA to launch without error
h3. Actual Results

JIRA launches with error and JIRA Software does not work

JIRA Agile v7.0.1-D20150831T075251 (a8911e5beba95691) started at 07 Sep 2015 01:58

JIRA Agile v7.0.2-D20150904T042837 (c3fc2e3787bad862) started at 14 Sep 2015 01:27

JIRA Agile v7.0.3-D20150914T124347 (7e76d8d76870cd63) started at 21 Sep 2015 01:19

JIRA Agile v7.0.4-D20150923T101309 (58e240c5cc26afe4) started at 28 Sep 2015 03:49

JIRA Agile v7.1.0-D20151020T142903 (3d19d53432899181) started at 26 Oct 2015 01:33

JIRA Agile v7.1.2-D20151028T015626 (f4e785ae6fe458a1) started at 02 Nov 2015 01:53

JIRA Agile v7.1.4-D20151111T031543 (0d6026ddf635f7e1) started at 16 Nov 2015 12:38

JIRA Agile v7.1.6-D20151117T003834 (2f84d577cde6ef35) started at 23 Nov 2015 12:11

JIRA Agile v7.1.7-D20151125T224928 (dfe715220fd03e9c) started at 30 Nov 2015 12:12

JIRA Agile v7.1.8-D20151201T145156 (d7cf536d7ae17636) started at 07 Dec 2015 02:07

*JIRA Agile v7.0.6 (c8e6505a72e83124) started at 08 Dec 2015 01:23
h3. Notes
h3. Workaround

UPDATE propertynumber SET propertyvalue = 48
WHERE id = (SELECT id FROM propertyentry WHERE property_key = 'GreenHopper.Upgrade.Latest.Upgraded.Version');
UPDATE propertystring SET propertyvalue = '48'
WHERE id = (SELECT id FROM propertyentry WHERE property_key = 'com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:build');

One of the 2 users could NOT Create Sprints - because the icon was greyed out.

h3. Summary
When using category not in (value1,value2) JQL does not return results where projects don't have a value for a category. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a few test projects.
# Create a project two categories i.e. test1 & test2.
# Add project a to category test1.
# Run a JQL query category not in (test2).

h3. Expected Results
JQL query should return all results where category doesn't = test 2. 

h3. Actual Results

It only includes projects that are test1 and it excludes all projects that do not have a category specified. 
 

h3.Workaround

In order for it to work correctly you have to include category not in (test2) OR category is empty.
